entry.title: extensions: Update Extensions events to use HostID rather than Extension Id
entry.content:
This CL updates EventDispatcher, EventRouter, ScriptContext, and related

classes to create, pass, and consume a HostID rather than Extension Id.

In normal extension codepaths when an extension is present, the change

is a no-op. Some extensions APIs are used by WebView / Controlled Frame

owning contexts, however, and this change allows those events to be

correctly evaluated against the targeted contexts.



Bug: 1233993, b/315342874

Change-Id: I1c8d1a4f73369470f945a9f585924e953a8f8766

entry.title: Move attribution browser tests assertions from host to manager
entry.content:
Current browser tests have assertions on the attribution host. With the

migration to processing responses in the browser, these tests

would no longer be relevant.



With this CL, we update them to instead assert that the right sources

and triggers are received by the AttributionManager (mocking further).



This will allow the tests to cover registrations via

`RegisterDataHost`/ `RegisterNavigationDataHost` and registrations in

the browser process coming from the `KeepAliveUrlLoader`.



`https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705075` will

be able to setup these tests to run with both feature flag values.



Change-Id: Icc77bf70cbad6a1f64867792c65e5a573ae30abc

entry.title: media/base/video_frame: Return int file descriptors instead of ScopeFD&
entry.content:
GetDmabufFd() returns a file descriptor ID stored in a reference to a

ScopedFD. Wherever these file descriptors are used, the caller just

calls get() to get the int file descriptor. Returning an int does not

break the ownership model, and allows for more diverse underlying file

descriptor implementations.



BUG=b:277581596

TEST=vdatests pass on Kukui

entry.title: Fix crash when triggering the ESB IPH Promo on a dangerous download
entry.content:
When a user tried to click away from the expanded partial view on a

dangerous download, chrome would crash.

Screencast:http://go/scrcast/NTMxMTY4Mzg2OTI3ODIwOHw0YmMxOWUxZC00ZQ



The problem was that a function, `FocusAndActivateWindow` was being called reentrantly when it shouldn't have. We avoid that by using PostTask to make sure that each call to `FocusAndActivateWindow` finishes before another call can happen.

Screencast:http://go/scrcast/NjU2MDI3NDM0ODc2OTI4MHxjNDM4NjQ5OC05OA

entry.title: [Extensions] Emit DidDispatchToAckSucceed metric for non-lazy contexts.
entry.content:
New metric:

Extensions.Events.DidDispatchToAckSucceed.ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage



Before this change we only emit DidDispatchToAckSucceed for events that

run in lazy context background scripts (event pages and service

workers). After this change it is now emitted for events that run in

non-lazy contexts (persistent background pages) as well.

//third_party/rust-toolchain/bin for both cargo and rustc, and then

can be found through the path.

entry.title: Use ToV8Traits<> instead of ToV8 in ScriptValue::From
entry.content:
In many cases, ToV8Traits<> and ScriptValue::From are heavier than

what is needed, and the normal ScriptValue constructor suffices.

Switch to the constructor in those cases.



Otherwise, switch the underlying implement of ScriptValue::From

to use ToV8Traits. This requires swapping the helpers to convert

non-ScriptWrappable IndexedDB objects from ToV8-style to

ToV8Traits-style.

entry.title: Wallpaper Search: Allow deselecting colors and descriptors
entry.content:
- Add ability to deselect default colors.

- Add ability to deselect combobox options.

- Remove 'restamp' on group's items to allow collapsed items to stay

in the DOM even though they are hidden. This fixes an issue where

the combobox wanted to keep selected items in the DOM and would force

collapsed groups to expand automatically to ensure its items were

in the DOM.

entry.title: Introduce the emulated forced colors provider to Blink::Page
entry.content:
This CL adds the emulated forced colors color provider to

Blink::Page, which allows for the simulation of forced colors mode via

DevTools. Currently, the provider is a part of WebThemeEngineDefault,

but it needs to be moved to Blink::Page as part of our efforts to have

all color providers in Blink owned by Blink::Page.



This CL also adds two methods to Blink::Page, EmulateForcedColors and

DisableEmulatedForcedColors, which will enable and disable the

emulation respectively.



The next CL will implement the painting logic using the providers in

Blink::Page.



Bug: 1430181

entry.title: [Code Health] Avoid TabStatsTracker outliving local_state
entry.content:
TabStatsTracker contains a raw_ptr to pref_service, which would become

leaked dangling as TabStatsTracker was never destroyed, despite

various comments stating that pref_service must outlive it.



This change adds a PostDestroyThreads method to tear TabStatsTracker

down (mirroring its creation in PreCreateThreads).



This change also makes progress towards fixing a leaked dangling

pointer in components/metrics/daily_event.h, but does not fix all

additional cases unrelated to TabStatsTracker.

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Add Nearby features file, extended advertising flag
entry.content:
Creates a new file specifically for flags to be used on the Nearby

platform. We plan to add several new flags to incrementally test

combinations of device support for our BLE V2 features, including the

GATT Server, GATT Client, extended advertising, extended scanning, etc.



More info at go/cros-nearby-blev2-testing



This file adds in the Extended Advertising flag, which will cause the

IsExtendedAdvertisements() API to return false when disabled.



the state of the feature in /etc/chrome_dev.conf.

entry.title: Check artificial prefixes in queued Safe Browsing lookups
entry.content:
Currently, if a request comes in before the database is ready, it

becomes queued. When the database becomes ready though, we do not

check the artificial prefixes. This leads to race conditions where

database lookups can be unsafe if they come in after initialization,

and safe if they come in before initialization.

entry.title: [gc] Move Font objects in tests to being on-stack.
entry.content:
This is a preparation patch for moving FontFallbackList to being GC'd.



Font will become a GC'd part-object in the subsequent patch, and as

such non-GC'd objects (the test classes) cannot have them as part

entry.title: gif_recording: Dynamic number of frames encoded with a stale palette
entry.content:
Instead of making the number of frames encoded with an old stale color

palette fixed at 20 frames, this CL makes the value dynamic and

proportional to the duration it takes to build a color palette.



The duration needed to build a color palette depends on various factors

such as the size of the recorded region, how fast is the device, and

the current system load. Hence, a fixed value doesn't make sense, and

should be made dynamic to adapt to the current conditions.



Fixed: b/318766970

Test: Manually on a slow device with various sizes, and existing tests.

entry.title: [DBSC] Respond to a binding challenge in /IssueToken
entry.content:
In response to a token binding challenge,

`MutableProfileOAuth2TokenServiceDelegate` should create a new access

token fetcher that would include a token binding assertion generated

from that challenge.



An extra complexity comes from the fact that

`MutableProfileOAuth2TokenServiceDelegate::CreateAccessTokenFetcher()`

needs to return a new fetcher object synchronously, but on the other

hand the assertion generation process is asynchronous.



This CL adds a new `TokenBindingOAuth2AccessTokenFetcher` class to

work around this. This class wraps

`OAuth2MintAccessTokenFetcherAdapter` and delays `Start()` until the

assertion is generated.



Bug: b/263253212

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in SQLitePersistentCookieStore::Backend.
entry.content:
The crypto_ pointer member was raw and it was possible for

this to be invalidated and accessed. This could happen because

the lifetime of the SQLite backend is refcounted and self-owned

and it might outlive network context and network service which

can both be destroyed before the Backend.



One possible scenario here is if the DoCommit() takes some time

and could still be running on the Backend background sequence

and try to access the crypto_ object to perform encryption to

write data.



This CL makes two substantive changes:



1. The pattern of ownership for the cookie_crypto_delegate is no

longer a raw pointer whose lifetime must be managed by the

caller, but is replaced by a unique_ptr strongly owned by

the Backend, created in the Network Context when required.



2. The interface to the cookie encryption provider is changed

to be specific to each network context, and not configured on

the network service, similar to existing cookie encryption. This

means there to be a single unique_ptr for the delegate per

network context and encryption configuration can be controlled

on a context-by-context basis.



The unique_ptr is now passed into the SQLitePersistentCookieStore

and lifetime is thus ensured. Several related interfaces are

updated to use this unique_ptr pattern, however, this CL does not

contain any functional changes.



A test interface is added to reproduce this failure by adding

a delay on commits, and the existing tests that use OSCrypt Async

are augmented to add this delay. The test previously crashed before

this CL.



BUG=1511730,1426805



Change-Id: Idc044af001c7e81e0c23fc12b008ec7b7837b530

was performing cleanup work immediately following a Nearby process

disconnect. With this change we just invoke Shutdown() but keep the

NearbyConnectionsManager object alive.

entry.title: Improve USB printer setup logging
entry.content:
The current USB printer event logs are not always sufficient for

debugging setup problems if there is more than one USB printer or the

printer returns unexpected USB strings. Several related fixes to make

this easier:

* Include the USB VID and PID in the initial log. This allows

identification of the real device when USB strings contain generic

entries.

* Include the printer name in more USB logs. This allows

distinguishing which logs go with each USB printer when there's more

than one.

* Log the full response from GET_DEVICE_ID instead of the parsed

MFG and MDL fields. This still makes it easy to see what the MFG

and MDL values are, while also allowing debugging when the full

string contains unexpected syntax or values.

* Log the name of PPD resolution result codes instead of the raw code.

This allows following the flow from the logs without

cross-referencing source code every time.



Bug: b/271572497

entry.title: Fix popover crash bug
entry.content:
It was previously possible to hit a CHECK (and I think some

underspecified behavior) with something like this:



Popover 1

Popover 2








The problem is that "hide all popovers until" doesn't end up with

the desired "until" popover on the top of the stack in this case.

There is already a similar situation within the "hide all..."

algorithm itself, but that only handles the case where a popover

being hidden by "hide all..." has the beforetoggle listener. This

is the same problem, but for the case that the "until" popover

has that listener.



I believe this needs a spec update. WebKit doesn't crash (likely

it doesn't have the same CHECKs that Blink has), but also doesn't

result in both p1 and p2 being hidden in the above example.



Fixed: 1513282

entry.title: [IntersectionOptimization] Improve and fix cached rect invalidation
entry.content:
- Move invalidation from

ObjectPaintInvalidator::InvalidateDisplayItemClient to

PaintInvalidator::InvalidatePaint because the former doesn't

invalidate LayoutObjects that don't paint while these LayoutObjects

can still observe intersection based on layout.

- Rename InvalidateCachedRectsIfNeeded to

InvalidateCachedRectsIfPaintPropertiesChange() because it only

handles paint property changes but not local layout changes.

- Skip scroll optimization if the cached rect is invalidated for other

reasons.

entry.title: Reland "Improve handling of notification actions in App Shims."
entry.content:
Includes fixes to AppShimListenerBrowserTest tests.



> Original change's description:

> > Improve handling of notification actions in App Shims.

> >

> > Notification actions should be able to notify the browser process

> > even if the browser process hasn't tried to connect to the

> > notification service in the app shim process yet. Additionally,

> > if an app shim is launched by the OS to handle a notification

> > action, we need to make sure to install a UNUserNotificationCenter

> > delegate before the launch finishes.

> >

> > To make this possible, this CL splits out what used to all be in

> > the constructor of MacNotificationServiceUN to now have separate

> > construction, mojo-bind and RequestPermission calls. This allows

> > app shims to create the service on startup, while only binding its

> > receiver and requesting permission when the browser process asks

> > for this.

> >

> > Also uses a single MacNotificationServiceUN instance for the lifetime

> > of the app shim, routing notification actions through a mojo pipe

> > that is setup on initial connection with the browser process, rather

> > than using the action handler mojo pipe that is passed when the

> > browser process connects to the notification service.

> >

> > Low-Coverage-Reason: TESTS_IN_SEPARATE_CL To test this, a bit more functionality needs to be in place first. Tests will be added once that is in place.

> > Bug: 938661

> > Change-Id: I412339d762873137cb97256d055abe3f9bb44399

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5078729

entry.title: Update popover=hint behavior to allow a stack of hints
entry.content:
The previous implementation only allowed one popover=hint to be open

at a time. Per conversation at [1], developers feel that it should be

possible to nest popover=hint popovers. This CL implements that

capability.



There are now two popover stacks in Document: PopoverAutoStack and

PopoverHintStack. Since it is possible to nest hints within autos,

the PopoverAutoStack can contain hints. However, there

are a few constraints:

- The PopoverHintStack only ever contains hints.

- Once the PopoverAutoStack contains a hint, all subsequent popovers

in the stack must also be hints.

- A popover=hint can never be the ancestor of a popover=auto.



The light dismiss behavior is roughly the same as before, with a

slight tweak that simplifies behavior: closing anything in the

PopoverAutoStack will always close everything in the PopoverHintStack.

That was not the case before, but it was a bit of a weird corner case.



Note that I found a crasher (happens in stable, with just auto

popovers) that I added a test for here. The bug for that is

crbug.com/1513282. I'll fix that in a followup.



[1] https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9776#issuecomment-1785814179



Bug: 1416284,1513282

entry.title: [Extensions] Emit DispatchToAckTime metric for non-lazy contexts.
entry.content:
New metric:

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionPersistentBackgroundPage



Before this change we only emit DispatchToAckTime for events that run in

lazy context background scripts (event pages and service workers). After

this change it is now emitted for events that run in non-lazy contexts

(persistent background pages) as well.



It reuses the existing ExtensionHost::OnEventAck() flow that event pages

currently use as it was easy to adapt versus creating a new flow that is

nearly identical.

entry.title: Fix and enable WebAppIntegration testing enter/exit fullscreen app.
entry.content:
WebAppIntegraion tests in which the test toggles app fullscreen mode

on and off by calling WebAppIntegrationTestDriver::EnterFullScreenApp

and WebAppIntegrationTestDriver::ExitFullScreenApp() (for example,

WebAppIntegration.EnterAndExitFullScreenApp) are flaky.



The root cause of the issue is because in Lacros when fullscreen

mode is changed, FullscreenController::WindowFullscreenStateChanged

is triggered twice for the same change asynchronously, which will

send 2 notifications of OnFullscreenStateChanged to all observers.



When the test code toggles window fullscreen mode on then off

immediately, there is a race between the second notification of

fullscreen mode on and the test code toggles fullscreen mode off

after turning it on. When the test code wait for exiting full

screen and observed OnFullscreenStateChanged, it should exit only

when fullscreen state has changed to its expected state. This cl

implements this approach and enabled the related tests.



I have configured to run

WebAppIntegration.EnterAndExitFullScreenApp 20 times

on linux-lacros-rel and all test runs passed.



Bug: 1481727

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Implement AsyncCheckTracker::IsMainPageLoadPending
entry.content:
AsyncCheckTracker maintains a set of navigation ids that are added in

DidStartNavigation and removed in DidFinishNavigation. It can then

determine whether the page load is pending with the navigation_id in

UnsafeResource (implemented in https://crrev.com/c/5171446 and

https://crrev.com/c/5171128). If navigation_id is not available,

we will continue using the old function

IsMainPageLoadPendingWithSyncCheck and async check should also be

disabled in BrowserUrlLoaderThrottle.



This approach works under the following assumptions:

* DidStartNavigation must be called if SB check is triggered.

* DidFinishNavigation must be called if DidStartNavigation is called

(to avoid memory leak).

* navigation_id remains unchanged. This is true because it is a

const[1].



An alternative is to store all navigation_ids in DidFinishNavigation,

but it is unclear what is the appropriate timing to clear them.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.h;l=2324;drc=2f89d705b0222190e3b26dee9f50c79efb0f52e6

entry.content:

menu, chip, bubble restart button) now go directly to the in progress

state rather than going to not started and forcing an extra click. The

exceptions to this are when the sync state is invalid, or the user

is in the FRE, in which case they still go to the not started state.

avoid it feeling jumpy.

entry.title: Fenced frames: window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork API surface
entry.content:
Add nonfunctional window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork API surface

(behind feature flag), which is not available in urn iframes. Later CLs

will gradually make it functional.



This entails the following internal changes:

* New fields `can_disable_untrusted_network_` and

`has_disabled_untrusted_network_` in FencedFrameProperties.

`can_disable_untrusted_network_` is true for all fenced frame configs,

but disabled for urn iframes at the same time as partition nonce.

`can_disable_untrusted_network_` is sent to same-origin renderers to

gate availability of the window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork API.

* Navigations through the FencedFrameConfig(url) constructor now store

`url` as the mapped url in the resulting FencedFrameProperties, so

that we can perform same- vs. cross-origin checks for availability of

window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork.



I2P: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/ofii__csdOY



Explainer: https://github.com/WICG/fenced-frame/blob/master/explainer/fenced_frames_with_local_unpartitioned_data_access.md#revoking-network-access



Bug: 1515599

entry.title: [content] Use TERMINATION_STATUS_NORMAL_TERMINATION for fast shutdown.
entry.content:
Terminating a renderer process via FastShutdownIfPossible() is very

similar to terminating it via Cleanup(), but in the first case

observers receive TERMINATION_STATUS_STILL_RUNNING while in the

second case they receive TERMINATION_STATUS_NORMAL_TERMINATION.

As a result, we didn't get the expected results in

Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination* histograms.



With this CL, FastShutdownIfPossible() uses

TERMINATION_STATUS_NORMAL_TERMINATION. This is the correct termination

status since FastShutdownIfPossible() is a deliberate decision by the

browser to terminate the renderer process.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS[Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination.HostedContentType]=Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination.HostedContentType is replaced with Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination2.HostedContentType because the logic for emitting TERMINATION_STATUS_STILL_RUNNING changed.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS[Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination.{HostedContentType}]=Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination.{HostedContentType} is replaced with Stability.RendererAbnormalTermination2.{HostedContentType} because the logic for emitting TERMINATION_STATUS_STILL_RUNNING changed.



Change-Id: Iddefe2d022bdb9a8e91c0ca10d6f2a9bbbc0ad29

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5125300

entry.title: Fix FrameSequenceTracker null timestamp
entry.content:
A crash report indicates that we had begun attempting to end traces with

a null timestamp.



This could occur with the update to the termination time of the traces.

It would require a series of dropped frames, followed by a

NoUpdateDesired. Leading to the V3 traces having no valid

termination_time.



This change updates the timestamp selection when ending the trace. If

we do not have a valid one for `last_presented_frame` we look at the

`last_frame`. If that is also invalid we use Now to terminate the

trace.



Bug: 1517723

Change-Id: Ia9a5181b32ddf7a45eb3ce2c64946032bc54eed7

entry.title: Use `ExtractAsDangling` before calling C APIs that call `free`.
entry.content:
Before the fix I was able to locally repro a dangling-pointer-detector

crash in:



- `Base/AudioOutputTest.OpenAndClose/0`

- `Base/AudioOutputTest.Play200HzTone/0`

- `Base/AudioOutputTest.StopBeforeStart/0`

- `Base/AudioOutputTest.StopTwice/0`

- `Base/AudioOutputTest.VolumeControl/0`



After the fixes these crashes no longer repro for me.



I wasn't able to repro the Base/AudioInputTest.Record/0 failure reported

in https://crbug.com/1502247 but the same fix should work there.



This CL uses `ExtractAsDangling` instead of rewriting `raw_ptr` into

`unique_ptr<..., CustomDeleter>` (as suggested in

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/dangling_ptr_guide.md#object-vended-from-c-api)

because the clean-up routines depend on state othat than just the

pointer (e.g. `pa_stream_flush` is called before `pa_stream_unref`).

The `ExtractAsDangling` fix also requires less additional code (no need

to write 3-4 custom deleters).



Fixed: 1517388

Fixed: 1502247

Change-Id: Ie1f4996f27c19bc9163af053fc51f79cf30521bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5191728

Reviewed-by: Tomas Gunnarsson

Commit-Queue: Łukasz Anforowicz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1246517}

entry.title: Prerender: Preserve the order of URLs in the ruleset when starting prerendering
entry.content:
Before this CL, PrerendererImpl::ProcessCandidatesForPrerender sorted

candidates list by alphabetical order of URLs for the efficient

comparison, and started prerendering in that resulting order.



This CL fix this behavior to preserve the insertion order of URLs in the ruleset as specified by developers and start prerendering in that

insertion order.



This behavior will be consistent with the Prefetch.

entry.title: [PriceTracking] Update showing condition in side panel
entry.content:
Previously, price tracking section showing up in price insights side

panel doesn't rely on side panel knowing the tracking status. One

issue caused by this is that if the call to fetch price tracking

status is slow, the price tracking section might show in a wrong

state. This CL fixes this issue by only showing the price tracking

section after the side panel knows the price tracking status.



Demo video with human enforced delay: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NOo9PKXG_ZueTjGRNuR3Jk7n5OinsoyZ/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-ePh2a9CnNzuyINxrmHIOGg

entry.title: Add a ContentSettingsType enum defined in mojo
entry.content:
The goal of this change is to migrate the source of truth for the

ContentSettingsType from a C++ header into mojo. Generated C++ from the

mojo definition is exactly the same as the enum in

content_settings_types.h, and moving the source of truth to mojo lets us

generate a TypeScript equivalent enum more easily.



This change also removes the complexity of type conversion with

`EnumTraits<>`. Avoiding use of `EnumTraits` is recommended in the

style guide.

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/mojo.md#using-mojo-enums-directly-when-possible



Generated Java enums are slightly different, unfortunately requiring a

small change to the type name in every usage.

entry.title: Reland "Define _LIBCPP_INSTRUMENTED_WITH_ASAN in libc++'s __config_site"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 2fec44e111ae7f5384f634c4909e6fd2e4728e4e

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/5163868 (since

rolled into Chromium) should've fixed the issue we saw last time.



Original change's description:

> Define _LIBCPP_INSTRUMENTED_WITH_ASAN in libc++'s __config_site

>

> This opts in to stricter checks for std::string in asan builds.

>

> libc++ checks for __has_feature(address_sanitizer) in addition to

> this define, so we can set it unconditionally -- in asan builds,

> our libc++ is always instrumented.

>

> Also add two more lines for toggles that have appeared upstream.

> I set them to what they were set to implicitly before. We might

> want to set them to something else though.

>

entry.title: [iOS] Stop creating command dispatcher for temporary browsers
entry.content:
As the comments in browser_impl.h suggested, both scene_state_ and

command_dispatcher_ member variables should be `nil` in temporary

browsers. This is currently not the case, and the app will crash if

in the future, web state list changes cause a command dispatch, because

the command will have never been registered with the dispatcher in the

first place.



This CL fixes the issue by really making sure that the temporary

browser doesn't have a command dispatcher.

entry.title: Convert web_test using eventSender to work cross-process.
entry.content:
The web_test http/tests/navigation/anchor-frames-shifting-focus.html

relies on window.eventSender to send events between two frames. However,

eventSender cannot send events cross-process, and when

IsolateSandboxedIframes is enabled, the subframe in this test becomes

cross-process (it didn't use to be).



This CL modifies the test to use postMessage for the cross-frame

communication, and the parent frame can instruct the child to send

itself events via eventSender (these still satisfy user-gesture

-activation requirements). With these modifications, this test should

work properly regardless of the state of IsolateSandboxedIframes.



This CL uses a similar approach to

entry.title: [iOS][FadeTruncatingLabel] Remove head truncating mode
entry.content:
Currently, there is some confusion about truncating mode head and tail.

The truncating mode should mean:

- Head for beginning of the string.

- Tail for trailing end of the string.

However, the implementation uses:

- Head for left edge of the UILabel.

- Tail for right edge of the UILabel.

The user of FadeTruncatingLabel then switches between head and tail depending on text direction (RTL/LTR).



This CL moves the text direction logic inside of FadeTruncatingLabel and removes FadeTruncatingMode as it's always tail of the string.

Also:

- Introduces textAlignmentFollowTextDirection that is used in popup row

cell to keep the current behavior.

- Fixes an edge case where the gradient should not be applied.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ib2cb9ec0f6b4fb6f7691178fc828c30a6960aeba

entry.title: [iOS] Autofill Across iframes: Set/get parent on drivers
entry.content:
This implements the GetDriver method of the AutofillDriverIOS, one of

the missing methods needed to enable filling across frames.



Because frames on iOS aren't directly aware of their place in the tree,

this implementation relies on the same events as remote token

registration. When a parent frame first dispatches a remote token to a

child frame, it now also notifies the registrar of the new token and

provides a callback. When the child frame registers itself using that

new remote token, the callback is run. This allows the child->parent

relationship to be established in the browser.



Bug: 1441921
